resources.string: Sudoku is a logical game, so no need to guess. If you do not know what number to put in a certain cell, continue to scan other areas of the playing field until you see the ability to insert the desired number. Sudoku is played on the playing field, consisting of 9 by 9 cells, a total of 81 cells. Inside the playing field there are 9 "squares" (consisting of 3 x 3 cells). Each horizontal row, vertical column, and square (9 cells each) must be filled with the numbers 1-9, without repeating any numbers in the row, column, or square. The more cells initially filled, the easier the game. The fewer cells initially filled, the harder the game.
